definition: Singles' Day (November 11), originally a day of activities for single people, but now also the world's biggest annual retail sales day
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: "Singles day" shindig is a popular form of urban youth celebrate.
sentences.chinese: “光棍节”的热闹聚会是都市青年流行的庆祝形式。

sentences.english: Singles Day was first celebrated at  various universities in Nanjing, capital city of Jiangsu Province during the 1990s.
sentences.chinese: 光棍节最先在90年代的江苏南京各大高校兴起。

sentences.english: Singles' Day began as a day for unmarried or uncoupled people to celebrate their lives.
sentences.chinese: 最初光棍节是单身人士庆祝生活的日子。

sentences.english: It's the singles' day which the ninth grade had its winter trek once again.
sentences.chinese: 光棍节的今天，是附中又一次冬游的日子。

definition: double seven festival, evening of seventh of lunar seventh month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女 are allowed their annual meeting

Qixi Festival or Double Seven Festival on the 7th day of the 7th lunar month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女[niu2 lang3 zhi1 nu:3] are allowed their annual meeting
(Internet slang) person who is neither married nor in a relationship (used self-deprecatingly)
Youth Day (May 4th), PRC national holiday for young people aged 14 to 28, who get half a day off
Children's Day (June 1st), PRC national holiday for children under 14
see 光棍節|光棍节[Guang1 gun4 jie2]
see 光棍節|光棍节[Guang1 gun4 jie2]
